item.title: Quick post on Bayes Theorem
item.description:
Bayes Theorem

$$ P(A|B) = \frac{P(B|A) \cdot P(A)}{P(B)} $$

Where:

  • P(A|B) : The probability of event \( A \) occurring given that \( B \) has occurred (this is called the “posterior”).
  • P(B|A) : The probability of event \( B \) occurring given that \( A \) has occurred (called the “likelihood”).
  • P(A) : The prior probability of event \( A \) occurring (before we know \( B \)).
  • P(B) : The total probability of event \( B \) occurring (the normalizing constant, which accounts for all possible ways \( B \) could happen).

This formula allows you to update your belief about the probability of \( A \) after knowing that \( B \) has occurred. It’s the foundation of Bayesian reasoning.

item.title: Reminder how to start hugo
item.description: Simply type ‘hugo server’ in the command window

item.title: Simple Web App Development Tech Stack
item.description:
Simple Web App Development Tech Stack

Stack Components

  1. Use vanilla HTML
  2. Use JavaScript - Access external libraries as needed.
  3. Use SQLite for database actions.
  4. Use Node.js for server actions.
  5. Use Git/GitHub for version control.

Project Structure

Project
├── package.json
├── package-lock.json
├── public
│   ├── index.html
│   ├── script.js
│   └── styles.css
├── database.db
└── server.js

Testing will be done locally on an Ubuntu laptop using Firefox or Chrome. Files will be edited using VSCode.

item.title: Using vim with Markdown
item.description:
Using VIM for editing Markdown.

Markdown can be edited with VIM with the correct plugins:

plasticboy/vim-markdown: Provides syntax highlighting.

dhruvasagar/vim-table-mode: Adds table formatting features.

mzlogin/vim-markdown-toc: Automatically generates tables of contents for md files.

vim-polyglot: Provides language support for Markdown.

iamcco/markdown-preview.nvim: Allows preview of markdown files in a browser. Live.

To preview the markdown live use ‘:MarkdownPreview’
